lines.text: [first lines]
He won't be talking to anybody.
What about that masked man and injun? They can cause us plenty of trouble.
Oh, we got what we were after. No matter who that masked man is, he'd never be able to figure out what that was. Come on.
Come in, my dear. You're a welcome sight for the tired eyes of an old man.
Oh, a man's never old when he can make a woman's heart flutter with such charming words, Padre. I bet you were a devil twenty years ago.
Oh, hardly a devil.
You have the tongue and courage of a coyote. You speak much, but you say nothing.

[disguised as Brett Reagan]
Now suppose you tell me who your employer is.
Employer?
That's right. It's quite obvious that you aren't equipped with the intelligence to be behind an operation like this.
He came here, he tried to kill me. I had to do it.
You had to do it so the City of Gold would be yours alone.
What?
You know what I'm talking about, Mrs. Henderson. You've told your last lie.
Redbird cannot say what will happen when next the sun rises, only that he will fight for his people.
Him die.
Do you have any idea why he was killed?
Why moon rise? Why cloud cover sun when rains come? Caulama know not why her man is die.
It's too bad the law can't help you. I'm afraid Tonto found out rather painfully what kind of a man our sheriff is.
Bruises on body go away, but sheriff have sickness that can't be fixed with medicine.
There's no doubt about it, Brady and the Henderson woman are behind these killings.
Why we not take them to law?
We could, but I want all the hooded raiders.
That plenty guns for us to fight, Ke-Mo Sah-Bee.

[being abducted from prison]
What kind of law is this, anyway?
Indian law.
I just wish I weren't so disgustingly healthy, Doctor. Believe me, I'd welcome a chance to become your patient.
Can you hear what's going on?
No, but I can see him good enough.
You think he'll talk?
Wouldn't you?

[disguised as Brett Reagan]
What about Brady?
He's a vicious, disgusting person. And his only use to me has been to carry out the necessary arrangements in attaining the medallions. I think you'll find a way to dispose of him.
Dispose of him, Ma'am?
I think you understand.
Yes, I expect I do.
You're not only handsome, you're clever.

[disguised as Brett Reagan]
And fond of livin', Ma'am.
Then you think I'll double cross you?
No exactly, but I venture to say that Ross Brady didn't think so either. One thing you'll have to remember, I'm not Ross Brady.
I know.
Shall we go in, Doctor, or do you treat your Indian patients in the street?
Do not worry, James Rolfe, I will not speak your secret. But I think that you will be a lonely man. You will always know in your heart the truth. You were born a red man and you will die that way.
I told him we didn't allow no redskins in here.
That doesn't give you the right to stand by and see a man almost killed. It's supposed to be your job to keep the peace.
Is it a wast of time to save a human life if the skin is red?

The cloud of evil has been lifted, Redbird. The masked man has brought justice to our land again and my grandson has been returned to me. Although my bones and flesh are old, my heart is young once more.
[last lines]
Our people have a new and shining hope, Paviva. A new life stands before us. None of this would be possible were it not for Tonto and the Lone Ranger.
Hi-Yo, Silver! Away!
